content.description: An object of mass <math alttext="m equals 2.0 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.0</mn><mo> </mo><mi>kg</mi></math> is moving in the <math alttext="x y" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane at a constant speed <math alttext="v equals 100 meters per second" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mi>v</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0.80</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>m/s</mtext> </mstyle> </math> in the <math alttext="positive x" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mpadded></math>-direction along the line <math alttext="y equals 4.0 meters" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4.0</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>.
content.question: When the object is at the location <math alttext="with coordinates 3.0 meters comma 4.0 meters" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>3</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>0</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mpadded><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mpadded><mn>4</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>0</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>, what is the magnitude of its angular momentum with respect to the origin?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
